title: Transfer Data Records
description: This sample project demonstrates how to read values from an Amazon DynamoDB table and send them to Amazon SQS using AWS Step Functions

introBox.headline: How it works
text: In this project, Step Functions uses the Lambda function to populate the DynamoDB table, uses a for loop to read each of the entries, and then sends each entry to Amazon SQS.

bullets.Seed the DynamoDB Table: Lambda function adds 10 new items to a DynamoDB table and returns a list of generated message IDs.
bullets.For Loop Condition: Choice state checks if the first element returned by the previous state is DONE. If yes, the execution ends at Succeed state. If not, it proceeds to the next state.
bullets.Read Next Message from DynamoDB: Task state retrieves message data from DynamoDB using message ID.
bullets.Send Message to SQS: Task state sends message data to an SQS queue.
bullets.Pop Element from List: Pass state removes the first element returned by Seed the DynamoDB Table state and returns the updated array.
bullets.Succeed: Terminal state that ends the execution of the state machine.
